verses.verse: To the chief<WH5329> Musician,<WH5329> A Psalm of David<WH1732> the servant<WH5650> of the LORD.<WH3068> The transgression<WH6588> of the wicked<WH7563> said<WH5002> within<WH7130> my heart,<WH3820> that there is no<WH369> fear<WH6343> of God<WH430> before<WH5048> his eyes.<WH5869>
For he flatters<WH2505> himself in his own eyes,<WH5869> until his iniquity<WH5771> be found<WH4672> to be hateful.<WH8130>
The words<WH1697> of his mouth<WH6310> are iniquity<WH205> and deceit:<WH4820> he has left<WH2308> off to be wise,<WH7919> and to do good.<WH3190>
He devises<WH2803> mischief<WH205> on his bed;<WH4904> he sets<WH3320> himself in a way<WH1870> that is not good;<WH2896> he abhors<WH3988> not evil.<WH7451>
Your mercy,<WH2617> O LORD,<WH3068> is in the heavens;<WH8064> and your faithfulness<WH530> reaches to the clouds.<WH7834>
Your righteousness<WH6666> is like the great<WH410> mountains;<WH2042> your judgments<WH4941> are a great<WH7227> deep:<WH8415> O LORD,<WH3068> you preserve<WH3467> man<WH120> and beast.<WH929>
How<WH4100> excellent<WH3368> is your loving kindness,<WH2617> O God!<WH430> therefore the children<WH1121> of men<WH120> put their trust<WH2620> under the shadow<WH6738> of your wings.<WH3671>
They shall be abundantly<WH7301> satisfied<WH7301> with the fatness<WH1880> of your house;<WH1004> and you shall make them drink<WH8248> of the river<WH5158> of your pleasures.<WH5730>
For with you is the fountain<WH4726> of life:<WH2416> in your light<WH216> shall we see<WH7200> light.<WH216>
O continue<WH4900> your loving kindness<WH2617> to them that know<WH3045> you; and your righteousness<WH6666> to the upright<WH3477> in heart.<WH3820>
Let not the foot<WH7272> of pride<WH1346> come<WH935> against me, and let not the hand<WH3027> of the wicked<WH7563> remove<WH5110> me.
There<WH8033> are the workers<WH6466> of iniquity<WH205> fallen:<WH5307> they are cast<WH1760> down,<WH1760> and shall not be able<WH3201> to rise.<WH6965>
